sentences: Tormisel merel oli laeva kiirus viis sõlme.
Laev tegi vaikse merega kuus sõlme.
context: In Estonian, 'tunnis' is an adverbial form that means 'per hour'. It's commonly used in the phrase 'sõlm tunnis' which translates to 'knot per hour', referring to nautical speed measurement. One knot equals one nautical mile per hour.
